activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12233
activity.text:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/842f5b27-79b2-49ad-b429-2e21c5f8a2b0)



I feel adding `Expired` badge along with `Active` status looks little confused 

> So the meaning of "status" here is different and does not have anything to do with the validity of the consent.

Yes, but the inactive status is related right ?

The `valid Period` already conveys that, right? -  I do not see any value in adding the expired badge just make it noticeable → May be just adding May 07 –May 10, 2025 (Expired) or Expired on May 10, 2025 if we still want users to notice it 

---

Why not just show `Inactive` badge in place of `Active` and no `Expired` Badge? When validity expire?

I feel the best thing would be a cron job doing at the end of each day.

According to FHIR, I think we can use Inactive status once the validity is expired

https://hl7.org/fhir/R5/codesystem-resource-status.html#resource-status-inactive:~:text=action%20is%20planned-,inactive,-The%20resource%20describes


https://hl7.org/fhir/R5/valueset-consent-state-codes.html#:~:text=~active-,inactive,-http%3A//hl7.org


----

May be later with follow-up PR, once the consent has status filters on BE, we always by default render only active/draft consents, other statues consents like inactive will be shown only when the user explicitly selects the in-active filter - Better UX

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12041
activity.text: Update Consent Workflow to Follow Clinical Standards

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12041
activity.text:
@hrit2773 

The first two steps are done in https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/pull/12033

```
- Create consent record with basic information (status, category, date, etc.)
- Upload signed consent documents or other evidence
```

We are not doing the 3rd step for now - we are not verifying or not sending any verification details. We will be doing it when there is a use case

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12033
activity.text:
@nihal467 I just realised that the search we are doing in for consent is client-side 😁

https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/blob/267e73b95c9c3cfacc1d1e298ee7203a210a413e/src/components/Consent/ConsentSheet.tsx#L87

So it is unreliable across paginated pages, and we do not have a backend support for filtering consents based on files attached 

---

I will get it as a follow-up PR, after backend support 

cc: @amjithtitus09

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12033
activity.text:
@nihal467 Thanks for testing 

> Major Bug

Actually, it's not a bug, that was a deliberate change made after discussion on [slack](https://rebuildearth.slack.com/archives/C06KGMUAB0V/p1745269867137029?thread_ts=1744207192.430929&cid=C06KGMUAB0V)

> add the file upload with the create consent slideover & file upload will be a optional thing

Okay, will bring it back there

> post saving, they shouldn't be redirected to the view details page

Okay, previously it was done because we kept it separate, will fix it 

> in the edit consent form, only the status and note should be visible allow to edit, hide rest on field

Okay 👍

> Currently, the consent search functionality only supports searching by the name of the first uploaded file. However, consents can be created without any files or with multiple files.

@nihal467 search works when consent has multiple files and yes, currently search does not work when no files attached because consent does not have any title, the search is file-based and will fix that to show consents that don't have files attached.


> When we upload multiple files back-to-back to a single consent from the details page, an error message appears in the pop-up as shown in the screenshot. Sometimes, the file upload or file selection itself also fails.

I guess the issue with the file upload component, this issue is already present on `care.ohc.network`, will look into it and fix it.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9f96ab5-4021-4968-9650-6bfdd5699f5a)

> Remove the green border when the note is not in focus

👍

---

cc: @amjithtitus09

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12043
activity.text:
@abhimanyurajeesh @amjithtitus09 

  Just thoughts 

 - Currently, the only editable field for an already submitted field is notes, every other field it non-editable. So I think directly editing from collapsible makes sense than opening the sheet from collapsible by clicking edit and then scrolling and finding the notes field and clicking Done again.

- But for not already submitted, we can edit all the fields 



  The expected flow is like filing all the fields and clicking Done in sheet, here I feel if they want to edit a single field it much easier to edit directly from collapsible input with a single click.

   Whereas the using sheet in edit flow as well like makes two clicks → Opening sheet by clicking edit then scroll and find the field they would like to edit. But this is like providing the same UI 

It's a choice we need to make, number of clicks vs using same UI

🤔

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2911
activity.text:
> [@yash-learner](https://github.com/yash-learner) Hi, could you please say is this a feasible solution? Could I work on it with you if possible?
> 
> * Give superadmins an API endpoint to toggle global_mfa_enforced.(field added to configuration settings or environment variables)
> * Give facility admins an API endpoint to toggle mfa_enforced(added as boolean to Facility model) for their respective facilities.
> * When logging in, check the status of MFA enforcement (both global and facility level).
> * If MFA is enforced and not configured, redirect the user to the MFA setup page.
> 
> Add appropriate UI changes ETA: 2 days

@ByteKnight-SRM 


> could you please say is this a feasible solution?

You just re-wrote the sentences of what I had written in issue description 😅

> Could I work on it with you if possible?

I don't think this issue is large enough to collaborate, maybe you can work on the FE issue when we file it.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2830
activity.text:
> @yash-learner Are we considering a case where all the backup code are used. So we will have to alert the user to generate new set of codes? 🤔

Nice catch @DraKen0009 

But practically, I would think this would never or rarely happen. In years I never logged in using a backup code. 

I think instead frontend should redirect user to user settings page whenever user logs in using backup code and prompt them to re-configure TOTP device properly, and this would regenerate the backup codes.

If a user ever continuously logs in using backup code, it indicates something is wrong with their totp device.

and 

A user can re-generate backup codes anytime as long as they are logged in

@vigneshhari what do you think should we handle this case ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2816
activity.text:
After a long debug

I couldn't replicate the above error when running `make migrations` inside a docker container, So I thought it may be because of a version mismatch 

local python - 3.12.0
docker - 3.13.1

So then I upgraded my local python to 3.13.1 and the above error is gone

>

> 
> cc @bodhish

@rithviknishad
